page.title: 03HOUSING IN SWINDERBY.
page.content: The village was a farming community with{farm houses and stack yards}along High Street. The oldest is Manor Farm 1695, now known as Manor House. Since the 2nd World War life styles and farming have changed. New houses have been built on the stack yards and the farm houses sold and modernised. In the surrounding area there are fewer farms but they are larger. Collingham Road, Meadow View, Manor Road and Newton Close have been developed on farm land and allotments. There are 2 groups of {Council houses, some{private houses}and bungalows and a group of specially designed{ old {peoples bungalows.} {Norton Disney Hall}is no longer part of the Estate. Norton was the Saxon name for village. Disney comes from D'Isney the Norman Lord who was given the land by William the Conqueror.
